text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT SALE - Japan's Food Agency bought 80,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 24,000 of Canadian western spring wheat, 20,000 of Canadian durum, 20,000 of Australian standard white wheat and 40,000 tonnes of Australian barley all for September shipment. The U.S. portion included 20,000 tonnes each of western white and hard red winter wheat, 32,000 of dark northern spring and 8,000 HRW ordinary.

WHEAT SALES - The Commodity Credit Corp bought 35,000 tonnes of hard red winter wheat Thursday for donation to Tajikistan. It bought the wheat from Continental Grain Co at $137.57 per tonne, FOB. Shipment was for July 23 to August 12.

CORN/SOYBEAN TENDER - The Egyptian state's Food Industries Company said it wanted to buy 30,000 tonnes of U.S. or Argentine No. 2 yellow corn for arrival in the second half of September and/or the second half of October and 30,000 tonnes of soybean, any origin, for arrival first half of October and/or first half of November. The deadline for the corn and soybean bids is noon (0900 GMT) July 22.

SOYBEAN TENDER - South Korea's state-run Agricultural and Fishery Marketing Corp on July 15 will seek 40,000 tonnes of No.1 soybeans. It seeks 20,000 tonnes for September 20 arrival at Inchon and 20,000 tonnes for arrival by October 20.

RICE TENDER - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organisation for Chemicals and Foodstuffs will receive offers until July 23 to buy 24,000 tonnes of white rice for August delivery, a GEZA spokesman said. Results would be available on July 24.

CORN TENDER - South Korea will seek 50,000 tonnes of corn to be delivered to famine-threatened North Korea, the state-run Agricultural and Fishery Marketing Corp said. Bids were due at 0300 GMT Saturday. Shipments will be 5,000 to 10,000 tonnes each in August to North Korea's port of Nampo.

VEGETABLE OIL TENDER - Egypt's state Holding Company for Food Industries on July 16 will seek 25,000 to 40,000 tonnes of cotton seed, sunflower seed and soybean oils for delivery in August. The tender includes 10,000 to 15,000 tonnes of crude sunflower seed oil and/or semi-refined cotton seed oil and/or American cottonseed oil PBSY 162 for arrival in the first half of August, 1997. - The same amounts and types of oil for second-half August arrival. Also, 5,000 to 10,000 tonnes of degummed soybean oil second-half August arrival.

MARKET TALK - In USDA's weekly export report for week ended July 3 old-crop wheat sales increased 735,100 tonnes, old-crop corn increased 477,300 and new crop 395,400; old-crop soybeans increased 76,400 and new-crop 590,200; old-crop soymeal 92,300 and new-crop 67,900; old-crop soyoil 51,800 and new-crop nil; and old-crop cotton down 20,000 bales and new-crop up 23,200...The Egyptian government said Thursday it had wheat stocks to last for the rest of this year and saw no immediate need to enter the wheat market...USDA said net soybean sales for the week ended July 3 to China for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year totaled 77,000 tonnes.

USDA said net 1997/98 soybean meal sales to China during that week were 50,000 tonnes...USDA said it would donate about 6,500 tonnes of wheat to Armenia and Georgia. USDA said it will donate the wheat to Cooperative for Assistance and Relief Everywhere (CARE) which will sell the grain through a sealed-bid public auction to private sector traders. The supply period for both is fiscal year 1997...The U.S. will decide "fairly soon" whether to provide more food aid for North Korea in response to the U.N. World Food Program's latest appeal, an Agency for International Development (AID) aide said Thursday.
